citeinfo.origin: Digital Social Science Center (DSSC), Columbia University Libraries
citeinfo.title: Java, Madura & Bali 1:250,000, 1943-1944

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the paper map entitled: Java, Madura & Bali 1:250,000 published by the United States. Army Map Service. This map consists of twenty one sheets, the online linkage file provides the index sheet and a polygon layer that serves an index for downloading the other twenty sheets. To download the map sheets using this index in ArcMap, add the layer, open the layer properties dialog, select the display tab, and check the "support hyperlinks using field" box while selecting the URL field in the dropdown menu. Then use the hyperlinks tool to select the polygon representing the desired tile. These map sheets were scanned at 300 dots per inch and are in the TIFF format.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. These images may be used in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: 20 col. maps. 45-52 x 45 cm. Standard map series designation: Series T521 Scale 1:250,000. Complete in 20 sheets. Set includes various editions and issues of some sheets. "Polyconic projection." Military grid. "Contour interval 100 meters." First ed. gives heights in feet with contour interval of 250 or 500 feet. Five classes of roads or trails, four classes of railroads, various types of air fields, and three types of internal boundaries are shown. Index to place names on these maps is issued by U.S. Board on Geographical names under title: Gazetteer to maps of Java, Madura and Bali. "Glossary" included on 2d- edition. Inset or marginal maps: Index to adjoining sheets

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.

procstep.procdesc: Original map was scanned at 300 dpi and saved in .tiff format with Colortrac5480 Scanner
